title: Amanda Holden exposes Simon Cowell's strict rules for women on Britain's Got Talent and X Factor
text:
Amanda Holden exposes Simon Cowell's strict rules for women on Britain's Got Talent and X Factor The judge admitted she agreed with the music mogul's strong views Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Amanda Holden shows off her enviable figure in revealing pink dress Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe 
Simon Cowell has strict rules for women on Britain's Got Talent and X Factor. 
According to BGT star Amanda Holden , the music mogul insists that female judges working on his talent shows are groomed and glamorous. 
"I have to shape up, wax my legs, up the glamour," she told the Daily Mail's You magazine. " Simon has very strict rules about the way women should look – plucked, waxed, made up and groomed to within an inch of their lives. I agree with him. It’s the Joan Collins method of growing old glamorously.” 
The ITV boss also allegedly likes women on his shows to compete with one another. Amanda Holden has opened up about what it's really like to work for Simon Cowell (Photo: Barcroft Media) 
Although Amanda has no problem when it comes to ensuring her looks are flawless, she told the music mogul that she would never pit herself against pal Alesha Dixon for the sake of ratings. Read More 
"Simon jokes that he loves to set women against each other on his Britain’s Got Talent judging panels and I said from the start I would never do that," she added. The music mogul has strict rules for female judges on his shows (Photo: Birmingham Mail) 
Explaining her thoughts, Amanda admitted that as a mother of three with two daughters, it's important that her little girls don't see her on TV "b****ing and carping" with other women. 
The 46-year-old will be returning to the BGT judging panel for her 11th year this spring, alongside Simon, Alesha and David Walliams . Amanda and Simon will be returning to the BGT judging panel with David Walliams and Alesha Dixon (Photo: PA) 
Commenting on her success on the show, Amanda admitted she still can't believe her luck to have been picked as a judge. 
"It’s been a life-changing job, helping me become a presenter as well as an actress," she added. "I don’t want to risk inflating Simon’s ego too much, but I’ll always be grateful he asked me to get on board!" Like us on Facebook
